comment.author: 92747288@N03
comment._content:
Tasmanian Museum. 

Corner of Argyle Street and Macquarie Street facing South East.

comment.author: 82973690@N00
comment._content: The museum was built by my great, great great grandfather Henry William Seabrook and his son Henry William Junior between 1861 and 1862 at a cost of £3772. Henry Hunter was the architect.

comment.author: 99479038@N00
comment._content: Macquarie Street to the left, Argyle Street to the right, Derwent River in the background, photo taken facing east.  Building on the left in the background might be the old Commissariat Store, now enclosed within the Museum grounds.
